critique: This executive order amends a previous order (EO 10450) concerning security requirements for government employment. It mandates that the Civil Service Commission report to the National Security Council on their studies, recommend corrective measures, and immediately inform the NSC of major deficiencies. It also requires department heads to advise the Commission on actions taken regarding employees subject to full field investigations. The order emphasizes national security and compliance, with reporting requirements to the NSC. There is no direct impact on immigration, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The order seems to centralize authority by increasing reporting to the National Security Council. It also appears to prioritize national security over civil liberties, as it focuses on security requirements for government employment.
